description: No Thanksgiving celebration is complete without a delicious cocktail to enjoy with your family and friends. This year, try the Cranberry Cobbler cocktail! All you need are some cranberries, lemon, orange, sugar,&nbsp;gin, and dry Sherry.
name: Cranberry Cobbler
recipeIngredient: ½ pc. Orange, sliced into thin rounds
½ cup plus 1 tbsp. off-dry Sherry

recipeInstructions.name: Bring sugar and 3/4 cup water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat. Pour off all but 1 cup of simple syrup.
recipeInstructions.text: Bring sugar and 3/4 cup water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat. Pour off all but 1 cup of simple syrup.

recipeInstructions.name: Heat syrup in a pan almost to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Add cranberries and simmer until they just begin to burst. Let cool in the syrup.
recipeInstructions.text: Heat syrup in a pan almost to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Add cranberries and simmer until they just begin to burst. Let cool in the syrup.

recipeInstructions.name: Place 2 tbsp. drained cranberries and 6 tbsp. Cranberry syrup in a large pitcher. Add lemon wedges and orange slices. Using a muddler or wooden spoon, vigorously mash the fruit. Stir in gin and Sherry. Let steep for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.text: Place 2 tbsp. drained cranberries and 6 tbsp. Cranberry syrup in a large pitcher. Add lemon wedges and orange slices. Using a muddler or wooden spoon, vigorously mash the fruit. Stir in gin and Sherry. Let steep for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Strain into a medium pitcher. Fill 3 glasses with crushed ice. Pour half of the mixture into a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice. Shake vigorously for 10 seconds and strain into prepared glasses, then mound with more crushed ice. Garnish each with a mint sprig and three cranberries.
